scope.goal: Develop a compelling landing page for TaskMaster Pro to attract remote teams struggling with disorganized project management and poor collaboration. The page will highlight key features, pricing options, and testimonials to build trust and drive sign-ups, ultimately converting visitors into paying customers for the SaaS tool.

tech_stack.frontend: Next.js 14+ App Router + TypeScript + Tailwind CSS + Shadcn/ui

features: Hero section with engaging headline, subheadline, purple/blue gradient background, and prominent CTA button for sign-up
Features grid displaying 6 key features (e.g., task assignment, real-time collaboration, integrations, reporting, mobile access, AI suggestions) using cards from Shadcn/ui
Pricing table with 3 tiers (Free: basic tasks; Pro: advanced collaboration $19/mo; Enterprise: custom support $99/mo) including comparison badges and upgrade CTAs
Customer testimonials section with 4-6 quotes, avatars, and ratings in a carousel or grid layout
Footer with company info, social media links (LinkedIn, Twitter, GitHub), and newsletter signup form
Full responsive design (mobile-first) with purple/blue gradient theme applied via Tailwind config
comps: Asana (robust PM features but overwhelming interface for quick onboarding)
Trello (simple visual boards ideal for small teams but lacks deep analytics for remote scaling)
Monday.com (highly customizable workflows but higher cost and complexity for startups)
scope.outcome: Live repo on localhost:3000 + Vercel URL + 80% test coverage

in_scope: Query UI component database for buttons, cards, tables, and testimonials
Design wireframes and apply purple/blue gradient theme
Implement all sections with Next.js, Tailwind, and Shadcn/ui components
Ensure responsiveness and basic SEO optimization
Deploy to Vercel with custom domain setup
milestones: M1: Research UI components and theme setup (2h)
M2: Design specs and wireframes approved (4h)
M3: MVP implemented and tested on localhost:3000 (6h)
M4: Deployed to Vercel with performance checks (2h)
risks: Limited component availability in database (mitigate: fallback to Shadcn customization or simple Tailwind builds)
Theme gradient inconsistencies across devices (mitigate: test on multiple breakpoints and use CSS variables)
Integration delays for future Stripe (mitigate: mock pricing CTAs linking to external signup)
